metadata.description: A devotional school prayer song written by Jagdish Khebdukar (1932-2011), a celebrated Marathi lyricist. The prayer has three stanzas, each ending with a different address ‚Äî ‡§ö‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§ñ‡§∞‡§æ (little bird), ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ (ocean of compassion), and ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ (sky). It asks for the power of words, wings of progress, knowledge, ethical character, and wisdom. This chapter helps students understand the meaning, structure, and performance of a Marathi prayer song.

concepts.title: About Jagdish Khebdukar ‚Äî The Poet
concepts.content: Jagdish Khebdukar (1932‚Äì2011) was a famous Marathi lyricist, poet, and playwright. He wrote hundreds of songs for Marathi films and stage dramas (‡§®‡§æ‡§ü‡§ï‡•á). He is especially known for writing beautiful songs for children and school prayers. This school prayer '‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§®‡§æ' is one of his most well-known works, sung by children across Maharashtra every morning. He received many awards for his contribution to Marathi literature and culture.

examples.text: He wrote lyrics for many famous Marathi films and nataks (stage plays).
His school prayer is sung in schools across Maharashtra every morning.
He was born in 1932 and passed away in 2011 ‚Äî a life dedicated to Marathi literature.
He received state and national awards for his contributions to Marathi writing.

keyPoints: Jagdish Khebdukar was a celebrated Marathi lyricist (‡§ó‡•Ä‡§§‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞) born in 1932.

His style is simple, melodious, and full of deep meaning for young minds.

concepts.title: Meaning of Stanza 1 ‚Äî Power of Words and Progress
concepts.content: The first stanza of the prayer addresses God as '‡§ö‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§ñ‡§∞‡§æ' (little bird ‚Äî a term of endearment). It asks for two important gifts: (1) '‡§∂‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä' ‚Äî the power of words, meaning the ability to express thoughts beautifully and clearly; and (2) '‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•á ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ñ' ‚Äî wings of progress, meaning the ability to grow, advance, and move forward in life. The stanza expresses the child's desire to soar high with these gifts, just like a bird in the sky.

examples.text: '‡§ö‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§ñ‡§∞‡§æ' ‚Äî God is addressed tenderly like a little sparrow, showing a close, loving relationship.
'‡§∂‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä' ‚Äî the power of words helps us communicate, write, and express our feelings.
'‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•á ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ñ' ‚Äî wings of progress allow us to grow and achieve great things in life.
The imagery of wings and birds represents freedom and the aspiration to rise above difficulties.

keyPoints: '‡§ö‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§ñ‡§∞‡§æ' is a loving word for a small bird; addressing God this way shows affection.
The prayer asks for '‡§∂‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä' ‚Äî the power and skill of words, like becoming a good speaker or writer.
'‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•á ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ñ' means wings of progress ‚Äî the desire to grow and achieve in life.
This stanza sets the tone: the child is asking for tools of growth ‚Äî language and ambition.
In Marathi prayers, God is often addressed with tender, affectionate words to show devotion.
concepts.funFact: In Maharashtra, school prayers are sung every morning before classes begin. This daily practice is called '‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§®‡§æ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§Ø' (prayer time), and students stand in assembly lines in the school courtyard!

concepts.title: Meaning of Stanza 2 ‚Äî Knowledge and One Passion
concepts.content: The second stanza addresses God as '‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ' (ocean of compassion/mercy ‚Äî ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ = compassion, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞ = ocean). This powerful name for God tells us that God is an endless source of kindness. This stanza asks for knowledge (‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®) and a single-minded passion ‚Äî the idea of having one dedicated purpose in life. It expresses the student's wish to focus all energy on learning and growing, without distraction. '‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä' means devotion expressed through genuine feeling ‚Äî not just going through the motions but truly feeling one's prayers and work.

examples.text: '‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ' ‚Äî addressing God as 'ocean of mercy' shows how limitless and deep God's kindness is.
The prayer asks for knowledge (‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®) ‚Äî the most valuable thing a student can receive.
'‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä' ‚Äî devotion that comes from the heart, not just external rituals.
One passion/focus in life means dedicating yourself to your goal without getting distracted.

keyPoints: '‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ' means 'ocean of compassion' ‚Äî ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ (compassion) + ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞ (ocean).
This stanza asks for ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§® (knowledge/wisdom) as a gift from God.
'‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä' means devotion that is heartfelt and sincere, not just showing off.
The stanza expresses the value of having a single-minded focus on one's goal.
Marathi tradition values both spiritual devotion (‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä) and worldly knowledge (‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®) equally.
concepts.funFact: The word '‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞' (ocean) is used in many Marathi names and phrases to show something vast and boundless. For example, '‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§®‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞' means 'ocean of knowledge' ‚Äî a title given to very learned people!

concepts.title: Meaning of Stanza 3 ‚Äî Become Ethical, Talented, and Wise
concepts.content: The third and final stanza addresses God as '‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ' (sky ‚Äî showing that God is as vast and all-encompassing as the sky). This stanza is the most aspirational ‚Äî it asks that the child grow up to become: ethical/virtuous (good values), talented (skilled and capable), and wise (having good judgment). It is a prayer not just for academic success but for becoming a good human being. The combination of talent and ethics is the ideal the prayer sets for every student.

examples.text: '‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ' means sky ‚Äî God is compared to the vast, limitless sky that covers everything.
Being ethical means having good values ‚Äî being honest, kind, and just in all actions.
Being talented means developing skills ‚Äî in studies, arts, sports, or any field of excellence.
Being wise means making good decisions with knowledge and experience ‚Äî like the owl (‡§ò‡•Å‡§¨‡§°), a symbol of wisdom.

keyPoints: '‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ' means 'sky' ‚Äî the vast, endless sky is a metaphor for how boundless God's presence is.
The stanza prays for three qualities: ethics (good values), talent (skill), and wisdom (good judgment).
This prayer understands that education should create good human beings, not just people with marks.
In Maharashtra's educational tradition, character-building is as important as academic achievement.
Each stanza's ending word (‡§ö‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§ñ‡§∞‡§æ, ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ, ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ) creates a rhythmic and melodic pattern.
concepts.funFact: The three things asked in the prayer ‚Äî ethics, talent, and wisdom ‚Äî match what Maharashtra's great reformer Mahatma Phule said: 'Education gives the knowledge to live with justice and dignity.' Education of the whole person has always been a Maharashtrian value!

concepts.title: How to Sing/Recite ‚Äî Rhythm and Performance
concepts.content: A prayer song like '‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§®‡§æ' has a specific rhythm (‡§§‡§æ‡§≤) and melody (‡§ö‡§æ‡§≤). When reciting or singing, students should: speak/sing clearly with correct pronunciation (‡§â‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞), feel the meaning behind each word (‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ), maintain a steady rhythm throughout, and stand respectfully. In Marathi performance, '‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ' (emotion/feeling) is very important ‚Äî the goal is not just to say the words but to feel them. The ending of each stanza (‡§ö‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§ñ‡§∞‡§æ / ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ / ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ) should be given special emphasis as it completes the thought and creates the musical climax of each stanza.

examples.text: Sing clearly and loudly enough for everyone to hear ‚Äî avoid mumbling the Marathi words.
'‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ' (feeling/emotion) ‚Äî put genuine feeling into the words, especially the ending of each stanza.
Keep a steady, moderate pace ‚Äî not too fast (rushed) and not too slow (boring).
Stand straight and respectful during the prayer ‚Äî body language shows respect for the song.

keyPoints: A prayer song requires correct pronunciation (‡§â‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§∂‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§§‡§æ) of each Marathi word.
'‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ' (feeling) is central to Marathi performance ‚Äî words must come from the heart.
The three-stanza structure means three rises in the song ‚Äî build energy towards each ending word.
The ending words (‡§ö‡§ø‡§Æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§ñ‡§∞‡§æ, ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ, ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ) are the emotional peaks of each stanza.
Daily practice of prayer teaches discipline, pronunciation, and appreciation of Marathi literature.
concepts.funFact: Many Marathi school prayers are composed with a specific 'chaal' (melodic pattern). Jagdish Khebdukar was skilled at creating songs that are easy to remember because of their musical pattern ‚Äî which is why this prayer has been sung in Maharashtra for decades!

test.question: When did Jagdish Khebdukar live?
test.explanation: Jagdish Khebdukar was born in 1932 and passed away in 2011. He was a famous Marathi lyricist who wrote songs for films, stage plays, and school prayers. This particular prayer is one of his best-known works.

test.explanation: '‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞' in Marathi means sky (‡§Ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂). In the prayer, God is addressed as '‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§æ' to suggest that God is as vast, unlimited, and all-encompassing as the sky above us. The suffix '-a' (‡§Ü) is added to make it a vocative form (calling out to someone).

test.question: What is the Marathi word for 'prayer'?
test.explanation: '‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§®‡§æ' (Prarthana) is the Marathi word for prayer. '‡§ó‡§æ‡§£‡•á' means song, '‡§ï‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§æ' means poem, and '‡§ï‡§•‡§æ' means story. Although the prayer is sung as a song, the word that specifically means 'prayer' is ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§®‡§æ.

test.question: In Marathi performance, what is '‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ' (bhaav)?

In Marathi poetry, drama, and prayer singing, '‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ' is extremely important ‚Äî it means putting genuine emotion into your performance so that the audience can feel the meaning. test.explanation: The prayer asks for spiritual and intellectual gifts ‚Äî power of words (‡§∂‡§¨‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä), wings of progress (‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡§§‡•Ä‡§ö‡•á ‡§™‡§Ç‡§ñ), devotion (‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞‡•Ç‡§™ ‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä), knowledge, ethical character, talent, and wisdom. test.question: Jagdish Khebdukar is best known as a Marathi:
test.explanation: Jagdish Khebdukar is primarily known as a lyricist (‡§ó‡•Ä‡§§‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞) ‚Äî someone who writes lyrics/words for songs ‚Äî and also as a playwright (‡§®‡§æ‡§ü‡§ï‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞).
